title: add set_timeout fn to TimeoutExecutor
body: This PR adds a `set_timeout` function to the `TimeoutExecutor`, allowing to change the desired timeout at runtime.

title: make map debuggable
body:
As @vanhauser-thc noticed, the map in a map observer is not necessarily debuggable.
Since it needs to be serializable, though, we can always implement debug for it.

title: Renamed Stats to Monitors
body:
This avoids confusion between State and Stats (very similar), but introduces Mutator and Monitor.. 
Anyway I think it's clearer, but the name is open for debate.

title: implemented MapMaxPow2Feedback
body: This adds a new feedback that only tracks new testcases if the edges count has at least a pow2 distance to the last

title: frida-asan: Support different names for the libc++ shared object when hooking
body: The `libc++` shared object can have many different names, and frida doesn't always do a good job of finding the correct functions to hook. This PR makes sure that the necessary functions are hooked.

title: Support suppression of hooked functions
body:
This PR adds the ability to suppress calls to hooked versions of standard c functions when using frida-asan/cmplog. It works just like regular instrumentation suppression (using `instrument-suppress-locations`).

This allows one to ignore a specific function call which is a false-positive/not-interesting while fuzzing.

title: Frida Refactor: Split FridaHelper into each Runtime

title: make dump_registers method public
body: This allows a user to dump registers at any point in time.

title: Fix cfg directives for frida-asan
body: Fixes missing/broken cfg directives from @tokatoka's frida-asan-x86_64 PR.

title: Launch every 100ms
body: When using the launcher, launch nodes at 100ms intervals to give the system a bit of time to breath, and to ensure seeds using timestamps are distinct.

title: Cmplog instrumentation
body: add support for special cases(cbz/cbnz/tbz/tbnz/subs)

title: Add minibsod
body: Add's the minibsod bolt, which provides `mini-Blue Screen of Death` output on crashes, including register dump, backtrace and mappings.

title: remove unused const hashing mode
body: There's not really any reason to spend more time compiling.

title: Fix MaxReducer docstring
body: Just a wrong doc string I stumbled upon

title: Mutational Push Stage
body:
This PR will (eventually) create a Mutational Push Stage that doesn't call an executor for each generated input, but instead returns the next testcase as iterator.
The caller of the push stage must make sure they execute the returned testcase, and that their harness populates the observers, as well as the `exit_kind`.

title: Fixed potential unsoundness due to Rc threading for ShMemProvider
body:
This fixes a warning in nightly rust.
So far, we moved a Rc<RefCell> to a background thread, but actually can just recreate the provider.

title: Fix warnings for windows
body:
very small pr; I noticed two warnings popping up when I upgraded rust to the latest
```
note: the built-in attribute `allow` will be ignored, since it's applied to the macro invocation `windows::build`
 --> C:\Users\toka9\source\repos\LibAFL\libafl\build.rs:9:5
9 |     windows::build!(
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

warning: `libafl` (build script) generated 1 warning
   Compiling frida_libpng v0.6.1 (C:\Users\toka9\source\repos\LibAFL\fuzzers\frida_libpng)
warning: unused import: `CpuContext`
  --> C:\Users\toka9\source\repos\LibAFL\libafl_frida\src\helper.rs:26:5
   |
26 |     CpuContext, ModuleDetails, ModuleMap,
   |     ^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: `#[warn(unused_imports)]` on by default

warning: `libafl_frida` (lib) generated 1 warning
warning: Now compile libpng with either visual studio or msys2
    Finished release [optimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 1m 01s
```

title: add ability to trace location information in concolic tracer
body: This is useful if you want to for example filter expressions later during solving based on location information. It is optional because precise tracing information can really blow up the trace size.

title: init git submodule for symcc for symcc_runtime crate when publishing
body: I had promised to add this some time ago. It ensures the symcc git submodule is checked out before publishing the symcc_runtime crate, as otherwise it won't be able to build on the docs.rs build environment.

title: don't include all of libafl for symcc_runtime by default
body: Just to avoid adding unnecessary dependencies. It's quite annoying when the build takes very long for dependencies that are not even used...

title: concolic optional runtime
body:
From the doc comment:
This runtime can be constructed from an [`Option`] of a runtime, concretizing all expressions in the `None` case and forwarding expressions to the respective runtime in the `Some` case.
This is especially useful for parts of the processing pipeline that should be activated based on a runtime configuration, such as an environment variable.

cheers
